result.execSummary:
The defendant Dezarey Marie Goozey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid directly to the Clerk of Court, 811 Harding Street, Waupaca WI  54981.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall comply with any other conditions that the DOC deems appropriate.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

ADA Bolz appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Atty. Jelinski.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of guilty to the sole count in the information. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and the defendant was found guilty.
Statements by counsel, joint recommendation.
The Court sentences the defendant to 3 years in the Wisconsin Prison System.
Initial term of confinement: 18 months.   Period of extended supervision:  18 months.
The sentence shall be consecutive to any other sentence being served.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge and Substance Abuse programs.
Conditions of extended supervision:  pay all supervision fees, undergo and complete all counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations, and any other conditions that the DOC deems appropriate.
As a separate order, the defendant shall pay all court costs within 60 days.
Appeal rights, WEDS form, firearms and voting restrictions were provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.
